question: Does protein ALEX1 contain armadillo repeats?
ideal_answer:
Yes,
ALEX1 (Arm protein lost in epithelial cancers, on chromosome X), contains two armadillo repeats domains.

snippets.text: ALEX1 (Arm protein lost in epithelial cancers, on chromosome X), contains two armadillo repeats domains, is expressed different in normal and carcinomas tissues.

Arm protein lost in epithelial cancers, on chromosome X 1 (ALEX1) is a novel member of the Armadillo family which has two Armadillo repeats as opposed to more than six repeats in the classical Armadillo family members.
